newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS - Highlands rejects Placer bid.
newsitem.headline: RTRS - Highlands rejects Placer bid.

text.p: Highlands Gold Ltd said that its directors had unanimously resolved to reject the takeover bid by Placer Dome Inc, citing an independent report showing Highlands shares to be worth about 40 percent more than the 75 cent per share offer price.
The Canadian company has about 33 percent of the Papua New Guinea miner. Each company has a 25 percent stake in the Porgera gold mine, which produces about one million ounces a year.
Highlands said in a statement that the independent report prepared by Barings Brothers Burrows valued its shares at 96 cents to A$1.14, with a mid-point valuation of A$1.05.

"Barings' mid-point valuation is 40 percent above Placer's 75 cent per share offer. This clearly demonstrates that Placer's takeover terms are totally inadequate and completely fail to recognise the intrinsic value of Highlands' three world class projects and exploration portfolio," said Highlands managing director Ian Goddard.
Goddard said the directors "unanimously resolved" to reject Placer's bid at a board meeting held on Sunday.
He said the Barings price was in part based on a 49 to 56 per share valuation placed on the Porgera project, which is operated by Placer.
